p: Airway surgery is inherently aerosol-generating, and many patients present without signs or symptoms of infection 13. The recent position statement from the American Academy of Otolaryngology and Head and Neck Surgery states that if COVID-19 status of the patient cannot be confirmed, then the patient should be handled as if they are COVID-19 positive 49. This position is supported by other discussion and commentary 47, 48. Teamwork and communication between anesthesiology and the head and neck surgical teams is vital for procedural planning. These discussions should consider the risk of transmission to other patients and to health care providers, as well as the benefits of stewarding PPE if procedures can be deferred. Possible strategies include: rescheduling, relocating, and the use of correct standards of PPE.
